etymologies: Old English finule, fenol, from Latin faeniculum, diminutive of faenum ‘hay’

definitions: an aromatic yellow-flowered European plant of the parsley family, with feathery leaves.

notes.text: Foeniculum vulgare, family Umbelliferae: two subspecies, a hardy perennial (dulce), the seeds and leaves of which are used as culinary herbs, and the annual sweet fennel or Florence fennel (azoricum), with swollen leaf bases that are eaten as a vegetable

shortDefinitions: aromatic yellow-flowered European plant of parsley family
